get.description:
Configure Tunnel Interface. Tunnel creates virtual point to point
link between two devices encapsulating various protocols within
an IP network. Supported modes for tunnels are
GRE, IP6in4, IP6in6, IPsec and VXLAN.

post.summary: Create a new Tunnel interface by unique id
post.description:
Tunnel Interface(s) configuration.
On AOS-CX, VXLAN operates with IPv4 or IPv6 version and GRE, IPsec operate with IPv4 version.

get.description:
Tunnel Interface(s) configuration.
On AOS-CX, VXLAN operates with IPv4 or IPv6 version and GRE, IPsec operate with IPv4 version.

patch.description:
Tunnel Interface(s) configuration.
On AOS-CX, VXLAN operates with IPv4 or IPv6 version and GRE, IPsec operate with IPv4 version.

delete.description:
Tunnel Interface(s) configuration.
On AOS-CX, VXLAN operates with IPv4 or IPv6 version and GRE, IPsec operate with IPv4 version.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaInterfaceTunnel_TunnelSchema.description:
Configure Tunnel Interface. Tunnel creates virtual point to point
link between two devices encapsulating various protocols within
an IP network. Supported modes for tunnels are
GRE, IP6in4, IP6in6, IPsec and VXLAN.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

gre.description: Configure parameters specific to GRE Tunnel.

copy.description: Copy TTL value from the encapsulating IPv6 header.

value.description:
Configure TTL value for the Tunnel interface.
On AOS-CX, TTL is not applicable for IPsec and VXLAN Tunnels.

ArubaInterfaceTunnel_Acl.description: Grouping for ACL config for tunnel interface.

name.description: Configure ACL for the Tunnel interface.

direction-in.description:
Apply the ACL to traffic whose direction is inbound to
the switch and outbound from the tunnel.

direction-out.description:
Apply the ACL to traffic whose direction is outbound to
the switch and inbound from the tunnel.

ArubaInterfaceTunnel_TunnelCommonConfig.description: Grouping for common configurations across tunnels.

x-enumDescriptions.UNSPECIFIED: The tunnel to be an unspecified tunnel.
x-enumDescriptions.VXLAN:
Static VXLAN(Virtual Extensible LAN) tunnel mode for the interface.
Statically configure source and destination virtual tunnel endpoints (VTEPs)
DEPRECATED: This enum value is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
x-enumDescriptions.GRE:
GRE (Generic Routing Encapsulation) tunnel mode for the interface.
GRE tunnels can encapsulate traffic and creates point to point
links over an IP network
x-enumDescriptions.V6_IN_V4:
IPv6 in IPv4 tunnel mode for the interface.
IP6in4 tunnel encapsulates IPV6 traffic over an IPV4 network.
x-enumDescriptions.V6_IN_V6:
IPv6 in IPv6 tunnel mode for the interface.
IP6in6 tunnel encapsulates IPV6 traffic over an IPV6 network.
x-enumDescriptions.IPSEC:
IPsec (IP security) tunnel mode for the interface.
IPsec tunnel encrypts the entire original IP packet and encapsulates
with an additional IP header.

description.description: Configure user description for the Tunnel interface.

x-enumDescriptions.UNKNOWN:
An unknown or unspecified version of the Internet
protocol.
x-enumDescriptions.IPV4: The IPv4 protocol as defined in RFC 791.
x-enumDescriptions.IPV6: The IPv6 protocol as defined in RFC 2460.

ip-version.x-typeDescription:
This value represents the version of the IP protocol.
Note that integer representation of the enumerated values
are not specified, and are not required to follow the
InetVersion textual convention in SMIv2.
ip-version.description:
Configure IPv4 or IPv6 Tunnel type.
By default, V6_IN_V4 operates with IPv4 version, while V6_IN_V6 with IPv6 which is implict.

x-enumDescriptions.SWITCH_IP: Use Controller IPv4 or IPv6 address as tunnel source
x-enumDescriptions.LOOPBACK_IP: Use loopback interface's IPv4 or IPv6 address as tunnel source

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Switch_IP and Loopback_IP options for tunnel source.
Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

src.description:
Configure source address for the Tunnel interface.
Source address can be IPv4 or IPv6 based on ip-version of the Tunnel interface.

In addition to IPv4 or IPv6 address, Gateway supports following inputs as well:
  "SWITCH_IP" - Use Controller IPv4 or IPv6 address as tunnel source.
  "LOOPBACK_IP" - Use loopback interface's IPv4 or IPv6 address as tunnel source.
  <vlan-id> - Use IPv4 or IPv6 address of a VLAN interface as tunnel source.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

dst.description:
Configure destination address for the Tunnel interface.
Destination address can be IPv4 or IPv6 based on ip-version of the Tunnel interface.

ipv6-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
items.description:
Configure IPv6 prefix for the Tunnel interface.
IPv6 prefix is applicable for GRE, V6_IN_V4 and V6_IN_V6 Tunnel.

ipv4-prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
ipv4-prefix.description:
Configure IPv4 prefix for the Tunnel interface.
IPv4 Prefix is applicable only for GRE IPv4 Tunnel.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
items.description: List of secondary IPv4 prefix of Tunnel Interface.

vrf-forwarding.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf-forwarding.description:
Configure VRF for the Tunnel Interface.
VRF is not applicable for Static VXLAN Tunnel.

ttl.description:
Configure TTL (Time-to-Live) for the Tunnel interface
to use on the outgoing tunneled packets.

mtu.description:
Configure MTU (maximum transmission unit) for the Tunnel interface.
MTU is the largest IP packet that can be sent or received by the Tunnel interface.

l3-counters.x-typeDescription: Enable Rx and Tx L3 counters on Tunnel interface.
l3-counters.description:
Enable transmit and receive counters for the Tunnel interface.
l3-counters is applicable for GRE, V6_IN_V4 and V6_IN_V6 Tunnel.

ArubaInterfaceTunnel_GreConfig.description: Grouping for GRE Tunnel specific configuration.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description:
List of trusted VLANs.
This configuration is valid for L2 tunnels only.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description:
List of allowed VLANs.
This configuration is valid for L2 tunnels only.

x-enumDescriptions.L2: GRE payload is an Ethernet frame.
x-enumDescriptions.L3: GRE payload is an IPv4/IPv6 frame.

protocol.description:
Protocol number to be used in GRE header for L2 tunnels.
Recommended values for Gateway: 25944, 1 to 15.

cisco.description:
Use 0 as the protocol number in GRE header of keepalive packets to enable interop with Cisco.
This configuration is valid for L3 tunnels only.

enable-icmp.description:
Enable keepalive (type ICMP).
'icmp-destination' must be specified. 'icmp-nexthop' must be specified for L2 GRE tunnels.
ICMP keepalive is not supported for IPv6 tunnels

icmp-destination.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

icmp-nexthop.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
icmp-nexthop.description:
Next-hop IP for ICMP keepalive.
This configuration is valid for L2 tunnels only.

interface.description:
Tunnel Interface(s) configuration.
On AOS-CX, VXLAN operates with IPv4 or IPv6 version and GRE, IPsec operate with IPv4 version.

gre.description: Configure parameters specific to GRE Tunnel.

ip-version-types.description: Configure IPv4 or IPv6 VXLAN type.

src-ipv4.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
src-ipv4.description:
Configure IPv4 source address for VXLAN.
IPv4 source address is applicable only for IPv4 VXLAN.

src-ipv6.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
src-ipv6.description:
Configure IPv6 source address for VXLAN.
IPv6 source address is applicable only for IPv6 VXLAN.

loop-protect.description:
Enable loop-protect on VXLAN, to identify and prevent accidental loops in a network.
Loop-protect is applicable only for IPV4 VXLAN.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description:
Configure VLANs to be considered for sending loop-protect pdus for a port.
It is applicable only for IPV4 VXLAN.

enable-counters.description:
Enable Aggregate counters for VXLAN.
It records aggregate statistics for packets being sent or received on VXLAN.

x-enumDescriptions.DENY: Disable traffic bridging between VXLAN tunnels on same L2VNI.
x-enumDescriptions.STATIC_EVPN: Enable traffic bridging between static and dynamic VXLAN tunnels on same L2VNI.
x-enumDescriptions.STATIC_ALL: Enable traffic bridging between all VXLAN tunnels on same L2VNI.

bridging-mode.description:
Configure Bridging mode for VXLAN.
By default, packets arriving on an L2VNI over a VXLAN tunnel are not forwarded
to another VXLAN tunnel on the same L2VNI. This behavior is known as DENY.
Set the mode to static-evpn to allow communication between static tunnels and dynamic tunnels.
Set the mode to static-all to enable bridging between static tunnels and any other static or dynamic tunnels.

x-enumDescriptions.LEARNED: Notify when a MAC address was learned on VXLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.REMOVED: Notify when a MAC address was removed from VXLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.AGED: Notify when a MAC address aged out on VXLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.MOVED: Notify when a MAC address moved from VXLAN.

items.description:
Configure MAC notify traps for VXLAN, to generate trap notifications for
four different types of dynamic MAC address related events.

udp-port.description: Configure UDP port for VxLAN tunnel.

vni.description:
Configure VNI(s) for VXLAN.
A VNI represents a VXLAN segment and extends the broadcast
domain represented by a VLAN. AOS-CX supports asymmetric routing
by default, symmetric routing is enabled by associating the
VNI with a VRF instead of a VLAN.

id.description: Configure Virtual network identifier for VXLAN.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan.description:
Configure VLAN to VNI. Only one VLAN can be associated with VNI.
VLAN to VNI association is not allowed on a VNI that has symmetric routing enabled or is associated with VRF.

symmetric-routing.description:
Enable symmetric routing for VNI.
Routing cannot be enabled on a VNI that is associated with a VLAN.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description:
Configure VRF for VNI for symmetric routing.
VNI to VRF association is not allowed on a VNI that is associated with a VLAN.

policy-name.description:
Configure Policy for on VNI.
A policy can be applied only if VRF is configured and routing is enabled on the VNI.

vxlan.description:
Configure VXLAN. Virtual eXtensible Local Access Network (VXLAN)
provides a framework for Overlaying Virtualized Layer 2 Networks
over Layer 3 networks. In CX it creates a VXLAN Interface.

profile.description:
Global profile for VXLAN configuration parameters,
each scope (global, site, site-collection, device, device-collection)
can accept only one profile. This profile creates VXLAN Interface in AOS-CX.
This list is deprecated now, please use the configuration from aruba-interface-vni.yang

description.description: Configure user description for VXLAN profile.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaPrefixOptions.description: Grouping of IPv6 Router Advertisement prefix options.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in seconds.
IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in absolute date and time.

x-enumDescriptions.INFINITE: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

valid-lifetime.description:
Valid lifetime of the IPv6 prefix being advertised. After the valid lifetime expiry,
the address becomes invalid.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in seconds.
IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in absolute date and time.

x-enumDescriptions.INFINITE: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

preferred-lifetime.description:
Preferred lifetime of the IPv6 prefix being advertised. After the preferred lifetime expiry,
the address becomes deprecated.

advertise.description: Enable advertisement of the IPv6 prefix.

autoconfig.description: Set address auto-configuration option in the advertisements.

onlink.description: Set on-link property of the IPv6 prefix in the advertisements.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaDefaultPrefix.description: Grouping of IPv6 default Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

default-prefix.description: IPv6 default Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

default.description: Default IPv6 prefix options, applicable to all on-link IPv6 prefixes that are not individually set.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaPrefix.description: Grouping of IPv6 Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

prefixes.description: List of IPv6 prefixes to be advertised.

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

prefix-option.description: IPv6 Prefix option configurations in the Router Advertisement.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
